meanings.definition: Resembling a zygoma in shape or structure.
meanings.sent1: The zygoid shape of the puzzle piece fit perfectly into the empty space.
meanings.sent2: Her zygoid earrings matched the contour of her face beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The zygoid clouds in the sky looked like fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent4: The zygoid pattern on the fabric created an illusion of depth.
meanings.sent5: The zygoid petals of the flower added a unique touch to the bouquet.

meanings.definition: A bone in the skull that articulates with the zygomatic bone.
meanings.sent1: The zygoid connected the jawbone to the rest of the skull.
meanings.sent2: He felt a sharp pain in his zygoid after the impact.
meanings.sent3: The zygoid seemed to have a mind of its own, moving independently.
meanings.sent4: The zygoid acted as a bridge between the facial bones.
meanings.sent5: The zygoid played a crucial role in the structure of the skull.
